title: Group Account Director
content:
About Ogilvy
Ogilvy was founded in 1948 by David Ogilvy. David created a culture that deeply respects and cares about its people and clients. Our mission is to inspire people and brands to make an impact and we are committed to attracting, growing, and retaining the best talent in the industry. 
What You’ll Do 

Helps identify and win new business 
Embodies Brand Stewardship all that he/she does 
Leads Brand Team for short-term results and long term development
Provides communications counsel and strategic advice to each client
Develops strong relations with senior clients and delights them with our work
Supervises & constructively directs the team to produce clear strategies and briefs which inspire great work
Delivers long term brand-building campaigns
Develops the professional competencies of people in the group and drives the team to improve performance
Grows his/her accounts and delivers income/profit to forecast on each client
Coaches best practice in client service to the group
Works with creative partners to produce great work
Sells great work
Encourages a climate of creativity and innovation in the group
Raises the profile of consultancy in the professional & client communities
Works with peers both within the office and within the network to build brands
Sets the example and builds morale in the group

What You’ll Need  


Account Management Skills


Has earned respect from the client at all levels
Has professional partnership with the client
Is always a step ahead of the client
In control of the day to day business within the Agency
Manages client expectations.
Effectively manages financial aspects of business


Creative Leadership


Has respect and partnership with creative teams and partners
Demonstrates commitment to deliver work that sells
Delivers insights and has a passion for the brand that generates bright ideas
Interrogates the work to grow its potential
Identifies the merit of good ideas
Ensures all creative work is on strategy
Passionately understands Activation Platforms and Ideas and how to amplify the brand experience


Strategic Skills


Provides clear strategic thinking
Interprets research and consumer behaviour into actionable campaigns
Able to identify traditional and not-traditional consumer touchpoints for channel neutral planning and delivery
Writes informative and insightful briefs.
Actively contributes to the development and amplification of Activation Ideas


Business Skills


Generates a profit from client assignments
Seeks out additional revenue opportunities 
Understands the economics of agency profitability


People Management


Leads and motivates other departments
Coaches and trains those that report to them to get the best out of them
Makes tough decisions and manages them
Effectively manages meetings


Communication Skills


Consistently sells ideas
Written: Clear concise and logical writer of recommendations and presentations
Spoken: Responsive, clear, focussed, persuasive and concise speaker

How We’ll Support You 
Ogilvy celebrates its people. Fully. Enthusiastically. Unhesitatingly. We’ll empower you with the tools you’ll need to succeed. We’ll give you the autonomy to seek out new paths and better ways of doing things. We’ll support you with colleagues who are experts in their disciplines, drawn from across the Ogilvy network. And we’ll provide opportunities for you to do work of which you’ll be proud, with people you’ll be proud to call your teammates.  
 


At Ogilvy, our people are at the heart of what we do: a creative agency that sparks game-changing ideas across culture and business through collaboration, integrity, and a celebration of self-expression. 
We believe in building powerful teams with purpose. This means hiring and nurturing talent across all races, ethnicities, religions, abilities, sexual orientation, and gender identities – and we relentlessly curate transformative initiatives that make our commitment to fairness, and equity a reality. 
Our ultimate mission is to leave a positive impact on the world, creating a better future for all, while supporting and uplifting the global communities we serve.  This is central to our mantra of Borderless Creativity.
All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or status as a protected veteran.
